text: Edward Leo Peter "Ed" McMahon, Jr. (March 6, 1923 â€“ June 23, 2009) was an American announcer, game show host, comedian, actor, singer, and combat aviator. He was the announcer and co-host of The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson with host Johnny Carson. Ed McMahon has also been on Star Search. He was best known for being on television. McMahon was born in Detroit, Michigan. He was raised in Lowell, Massachusetts and in Mexico, Maine. McMahon studied at Boston College and at The Catholic University of America. His career began in 1957 while broadcasting in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. McMahon was married to Alyce Ferrill from 1945 until they divorced in 1974. Later, he married Victoria Valentine from 1976 until they divorced in 1989. Lastly, he married Pam Hurn from 1992 until his death in 2009. McMahon died at the Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center in Los Angeles, California from pneumonia, aged, 86. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1923 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:American television presenters Category:American television personalities Category:American television actors Category:American philanthropists Category:Actors from Detroit Category:Actors from Massachusetts Category:Actors from Maine Category:Comedians from Detroit Category:Comedians from Massachusetts Category:People from Lowell, Massachusetts Category:Comedians from Maine
title: Ed McMahon
